name: Lloyd's Healthy Chicken Zoopa
author: Lloyd Newman
summary: This is a throw together soup that is satisfying and maybe even healthy. When you first saute the veggies in oil, you are making a 'moughe'. This is my own word, actually stolen from my daughter Amy (then 3 years old)!
ingredients: ½ pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite size pieces
directions: Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium heat
Add garlic, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, celery, carrot and leek
Saute until onions are translucent and balance of veggies has been tossed through with hot oil
Add stock and season with salt and pepper to taste
If using hot pepper sauce and soy sauce, add now
Bring soup to a simmer and allow to simmer over low heat for about 40 minutes
(Note: Volume of spinach will appear to be too great for the pot; don't worry, just put it in - within a few minutes it will be reduced to size)
Stir again and add chicken strips
Make sure soup is still simmering
Exactly 5 minutes later, you will have a terrific hot soup
